description: From Middle English, from Middle French inséparable, from Latin īnsēparābilis. Constructed as in- +‎ separable.

adjectives.description: inseparable (comparative more inseparable, superlative most inseparable)

entries.meaning: Unable to be separated; bound together permanently.
Something that cannot be separated from something else.
examples: Jayanta does so in answering an opponent who declares that the very idea of a relation between two inseparables is self-contradictory. How can inseparability and relation be reconciled?
